content.1: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
content.2: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
content.3: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
content.4: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
content.5: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
content.6: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
content.8: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
content.9: What knowest thou, that we know not?

content.13: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest
content.15: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
content.16: How much more abominable and filthy
content.17: I will shew thee, hear me; and that
content.18: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid
content.19: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
content.20: The wicked man travaileth with pain all
content.22: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
content.24: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
content.25: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
content.27: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on
content.28: And he dwelleth in desolate cities,
content.29: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
content.30: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
content.31: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
content.32: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
content.33: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
content.35: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
